H0.text: Endothermic reactions are the type of reactions that absorb heat from their surroundings.

H1.text: Geothermic reactions absorb heat from their surroundings.

H2.text: Hypothermic reactions absorb heat from their surroundings.

H3.text: Exothermic reactions are the type of reactions that absorb heat from their surroundings.

A4.text: An endothermic process is a chemical or physical process that absorbs heat from its surroundings.

A5.text: Thus, an endothermic reaction generally leads to an increase in the temperature of the system and a decrease in that of the surroundings.
